Title:
Helicocentralis hyalina gen. et sp. nov., an aero-aquatic
helicosporous fungus (Leotiomycetes, Ascomycota) in Thailand
Keywords:
Aero-aquatic fungi, freshwater, Dothideomycetes,
Helicocentralis hyalina, helicosporous hyphomycetes, Leotiomycetes,
molecular phylogeny, wood, Thailand
Abstract:
During a survey of aero-aquatic fungi in Thailand, an
undescribed helicosporous fungus was discovered. It is characterized by
the presence of branched and septate hyphae with hyaline coniodiophores
that are micronematous or semiâmacronematous, acrogenous and
holoblastic. Conidia, coiled in a three-dimensional plane, are hyaline
and centrifugally coiled (excentric), helicoid or circinate, coiled 2-3
times clockwise or counterclockwise. After comparison of morphological
and molecular characters with other aero aquatic, helicosporous fungi,
it is proposed to introduce a new genus and species Helicocentralis
hyalina gen. et sp. nov. Phylogenetic analyses based on the combined
sequence data from the nuclear small and large subunits ribosomal DNA
(SSU and LSU), as well as ITS rDNA sequence data, the fungus groups
within the Leotiomycetes with strong statistical support. The new genus
is not related to other helicosporous hyphomycete genera (Helicoma,
Helicomyces, HelicoÃ¶n, and Helicosporium), which belong in the
Tubeufiaceae, Dothideomycetes. Within the Leotiomycetes our new fungus
is distantly related to Helicodendron paradoxum (the type species). The
new fungus is also compared morphologically to six similar helicosporous
genera from Dothideomycetes and Leotiomycetes.
